title: Understanding Eating Disorders
text: Eating disorders are complex mental health conditions that often require medical and psychological intervention. They are characterized by abnormal eating habits that negatively affect a person's physical or mental health.

title: Common Types of Eating Disorders
text: Some common types of eating disorders include Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, and Binge Eating Disorder. Each has distinct symptoms and health risks.

hintAnswer: an illness where there is an abnormal disturbance in attitudes and behaviors related to food
title: Defining Eating Disorders
text: An eating disorder is defined as an illness where there is an abnormal disturbance in attitudes and behaviors related to food. This can include extreme emotions, attitudes, and behaviors surrounding weight and food issues.
choices: an illness where there is an abnormal disturbance in attitudes and behaviors related to food
displeasure with body image and behavioral rigidity, meaning that the person may have habits that are $$inflexible$$, compulsive, and resistive to change
$$self-induced$$ restriction of food, due to fear of weight gain, that results in weight lowering to below the normal parameters for age and height
